result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Stefon Wattley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$404.00  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations

timeConds.notes: 1 year conditional jail time.   183 days jail credit.  No good time, huber privileges.

CASH BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

**AMENDED** - ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
$40,000 to $10,000 - Same non-monetary conditions.
See notes for ARGN, held same date and time.
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

03:59 PM  Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County. Defendant Brian Stefon Wattley in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail,  with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak, appearing by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.    Atty Pollak acknowledges information, waives reading, enters plea of NG on behalf of DEF.   Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court enters NG plea.  Court questions Atty Pollak on motion to dismiss based on Information, motion to dismiss is now mute.  Atty Pollak requests to be heard on bond reduction motion.  Atty Pollak makes statement in support of bond reduction.  State makes statement, agrees bond can be reduced but should still remain a large cash bond.  Court makes statement, reviews criminal complaint, see DEF as flight risk, new charges filed.  Court reduces cash bond to $10,000, non-monetary conditions to remain unchanged.  Atty Pollak requests STC.  Discussion among all parties on scheduling.  Court sets STC for 5/5/22 at 11:30AM.  DEF makes a statement.  

COURT:  CBS $10,000   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Arraignment on April 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

08:35 AM Defendant Brian Stefon Wattley in court, appearing in person in custody, with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Pollak makes statement, has filled a motion to dismiss count 1.  State objects to hearing motion, premature.  Atty Pollak rebuttal.  State makes additional statement on objection.  Court indicates we will move to preliminary hearing, preserving Atty Pollak motion to dismiss.  State indicates ready to proceed, calling Deputy Dennis Nelson. 8:38AM Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  8:44AM Witness identifies DEF.  State continues questioning witness.  8:49AM State tenders witness, Atty Pollak cross examines.  8:53AM Atty Pollak tenders witness.  State has no re-cross.  Witness excused.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Pollak has no witnesses, no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  State requests time to file the Information.  Court sets ARGN for 4/8/22 at 4pm.  Court will also hear Atty Polllak's motion.,  Arraignment scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
